data.enText: to sit an examination in mathematics

data.chText: 通过普通中等教育证书考试的考生

data.enText: Applicants are selected for jobs on the results of a competitive examination.
data.chText: 竞聘者按遴选考试结果择优录用。

data.text: 可以说take/do/sit an examination，不作write an examination 。

data.enText: the act of looking at or considering sth very carefully
Careful examination of the ruins revealed an even earlier temple.
data.chText: 仔细考察这片废墟后发现了一座更为古老的庙宇。

data.enText: On closer examination it was found that the signature was not genuine.
data.chText: 经过进一步认真检查发现签名是伪造的。

data.enText: Your proposals are still under examination .
data.chText: 你的提议仍在审查之中。
这个问题需要进一步考察。

data.enText: The chapter concludes with a brief examination of some of the factors causing family break-up.
data.chText: 本章结束时简要探讨了引起家庭破裂的某些因素。

data.enText: a close look at sth/sb, especially to see if there is anything wrong or to find the cause of a problem

Exam is the usual word for a written, spoken or practical test at school or college, especially an important one that you need to do in order to get a qualification. Examination is a very formal word. A test is something that students might be given in addition to, or sometimes instead of, regular exams, to see how much they have learned. A very short informal test is called a quiz in NAmE . Quiz in both NAmE and BrE also means a contest in which people try to answer questions.
data.chText: exam为常用词，指学校的笔试、口试或操作考试，尤指为取得学历必须参加的重要考试。examination是很正式的词。test是指除正规考试外，对学生所学知识的测验，有时也取代正规考试。在北美英语中非正规的小测验称为quiz；在北美英语和英国英语中quiz亦指问答竞赛：

simple_means.memory_skill: examin(e) 检查 + -ation 名词后缀

ex.enText: The teacher gave us a mathematics quiz.
ex.chText: 老师给我们做了一次数学测验。

ex.enText: He failed to pass this quiz.
We're going to have a physics quiz tomorrow.
ex.chText: 明天我们将进行物理测验。

synonyms.bx: 通常指老师对学生进行的口头或书面的非正式测验，一般时间较短。

ex.enText: The school gave us an entrance examination.
ex.chText: 学校对我们进行了一次入学考试。

ex.enText: He passed his examinations with success.
ex.chText: 他成功地通过了各科考试。

ex.enText: We should revise for the examinations.
ex.chText: 我们应当复习迎接考试。

synonyms.bx: 通常指为检查学生知识或能力而举行的重要考试，有时也指临时考试。

ex.enText: They are to have a spelling test next week.
You need more practice before taking the driving test.
ex.chText: 考驾照前，你需要多多练习。

ex.enText: If you fail your initial test, you may take another test 3 months later.
ex.chText: 如果第一次测试没有通过，你可以在3个月后再测试一次。

synonyms.bx: 多指对实际技能、能力、知识等的考查、考试、小考。

tr: the act of examining something closely (as for mistakes)
the act of giving students or candidates a test (as by questions) to determine what they know or have learned
a detailed inspection of your conscience (as done daily by Jesuits)
a set of questions or exercises evaluating skill or knowledge
example: when the test was stolen the professor had to make a new set of questions

value.def: An examination is a formal test that you take to show your knowledge or ability in a particular subject, or to obtain a qualification.
If you have a medical examination, a doctor looks at your body, feels it, or does simple tests in order to check how healthy you are.
